page.title: 06CHURCHES AND CHURCH GOING
page.content: The Church of England is the only religion represented in the census area. A curate is in charge of the two churches in this area. The churches are part of a larger group under the overall charge of a vicar. Services are held at different times on Sundays at Albury and Little Hadham by the curate who lives at Albury. About 4%-9% attend services on Sundays, more go to the mid-morning service than the early one. A formal service in the village hall attracts more people, especially the old who can not get up to the church, which is half a mile from the main village, and also by young families.
